page.title: 06Transport (Road)
page.content: The A171, Whitby to Middlesborough and A169 Whitby to Pickering roads run through the region. Secondary and minor roads join settlements to each other and to the main roads. There are a number of private roads leading to farms and dispersed homes and the private schools. There are two bus routes through the region one to Whitby and one to Goathland, Pickering and Malton. One of the functions of the service is to transport children over 11 to Eskdale and Whitby schools. Few people use the bus service to get to work. There is much use of private and company cars. As a result of this, very few people use the bus service regularly. The services are run by the United Bus Company.
